error.signature: Error: The job running on runner GitHub Actions has exceeded the maximum execution time of 360 minutes
error.regex: (?:exceeded the maximum execution time|job exceeded.*time limit|timeout.*runner|The job.*has been cancelled.*timed out)

verdict.summary: A GitHub Actions job exceeds the default 6-hour (360-minute) time limit or a custom timeout-minutes value. Usually caused by hanging processes, infinite loops, or builds that are genuinely too slow for the runner.

dead_ends.action: Simply increase timeout-minutes to a very large value
dead_ends.why_fails: Masks the underlying issue (hanging process, inefficient build); wastes CI minutes and delays feedback; GitHub has a hard cap of 360 minutes

dead_ends.action: Re-run the workflow without investigating the root cause
dead_ends.why_fails: Timeouts from hangs or slow builds are deterministic and will recur on every run

workarounds.action: Identify and fix the hanging process or optimize the slow build step
workarounds.how: Add verbose logging to each step, use 'timeout' command for individual processes, check for interactive prompts that block CI, and parallelize test suites

workarounds.action: Split the job into smaller parallel jobs and use matrix strategy
workarounds.how: Use 'strategy: matrix' to parallelize work across multiple runners. Split test suites with tools like jest --shard or pytest-split

leads_to.condition: When the timeout is caused by a specific flaky test hanging

preceded_by.condition: When cache miss causes full rebuild, significantly increasing build time

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Timeout means the job ran too long; concurrency cancellation means the job was actively cancelled by a newer run
